## Reading CSV file

Analyze the target types. Filter and group data by target type. Read file and take a glimpse.

```{r global terrorism}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
gtd_data <- read.csv("globalterrorismdb_0718dist.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
glimpse(gtd_data)

```

## Cleaning data or data wrangling

Role 1: Group and prepare data by attack type. Select chosen column and clean NAs from nkill column.

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
gtd_clean <- gtd_data %>%
  select(iyear, country_txt, targtype1, targtype2, targtype3) %>%
  filter(!is.na(targtype1), !is.na(targtype2), !is.na(targtype3))


glimpse(gtd_clean)

# View a summary of cleaned data.
summary(gtd_clean)
```
## Sums

Role 2: Count the number of each attack type.

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
# Creates data frame.
df <- data.frame(Type_1 = gtd_clean$targtype1, Type_2 = gtd_clean$targtype2, Type_3 = gtd_clean$targtype3)

sum(df$Type_1)
sum(df$Type_2)
sum(df$Type_3)
```
